channel.title: Latest alerts from washingtonpost.com
channel.description: An unofficial feed created by Derek Willis.

item.title: Miami elects Eileen Higgins, who is set to become the city’s first Democratic mayor in nearly 30 years
item.description: Higgins will become the first female mayor in the history of Miami. The contest attracted attention from President Donald Trump and national Democrats.

item.title: The 10 best TV shows of the year, rated by our critic
item.description: It’s been a tricky year for an embattled industry, but at least we got to watch Diego Luna, Michelle Williams, Jason Momoa and Nathan Fielder. Did your favorite show make the cut?

item.title: FDA to probe whether adult deaths are linked to coronavirus vaccine
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration’s investigation is part of a probe that has alleged children died as a result of the shots, federal health officials said. Previous reviews have found that vaccines to fight covid are generally safe.

item.title: Silver prices smash a new record, outpacing gold
item.description: The precious metal has more than doubled in value since the start of the year, rising above $60 per troy ounce on New York’s Commodity Exchange on Tuesday for the first time ever.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Father-in-law isn’t subtle about hating his grandkid’s name
item.description: Carolyn Hax: Father-in-law isn’t subtle about hating his grandkid’s name

item.title: Study shows how your brain changes at four key ages: 9, 32, 66 and 83
item.description: In a study published in the journal Nature Communications, researchers looked at about 4,000 scans from healthy people ages 0 to 90. They found four major times when the brain underwent developmental changes, dividing the lifespan into five distinct epochs.

item.title: A marriage gap is growing — and it could spell disaster
item.description: The “war on boys” could be resulting in some women shunning marriage.

item.title: Judge orders release of ‘voluminous’ records in Ghislaine Maxwell case
item.description: Before releasing the records, the Justice Department must redact information that could identify victims of Jeffrey Epstein, the wealthy sex trafficker whom Maxwell was convicted of assisting, the judge wrote.

item.title: A new peace prize in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Tuesday points.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine. Trump’s power. Nancy Mace. Netflix bid. Forever chemicals. Golden Globes. Brain aging. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: What’s the most common zodiac sign? What about the most common birthday?
item.description: Are some signs and birthdays more widespread? And why does it seem like all of my colleagues (or neighbors) have the same sign? The Department of Data is on the case.

item.title: Pete Hegseth’s ‘who cares?’ doctrine is finally taking heat, David Ignatius writes
item.description: In U.S. history, war crimes have been rare. Accountability is needed to keep them that way.

item.title: Ukraine will not surrender territory to Russia, Zelensky says, which could mark collapse of Trump’s plan to end war
item.description: The unequivocal declaration that Ukraine would not cede its land could spur the breakdown of President Donald Trump’s latest proposal to end the war, which critics have condemned as fulfilling Russian President Vladimir Putin’s wish list. Some Ukrainian officials held out hope that the negotiations could still bear fruit.

item.title: Alina Habba, Trump’s embattled pick for top New Jersey prosecutor, resigns after appeals court ruled she was serving unlawfully
item.description: Habba announced the decision in a statement posted to social media and said she intends to continue serving as a senior Justice Department adviser.

item.title: Supreme Court seems poised to expand Trump’s power over independent agencies by allowing him to fire an FTC commissioner
item.description: The justices seem likely to allow the president to fire a member of the Federal Trade Commission, a ruling that could limit or overturn a nine-decade-old precedent that insulated some agencies from political influence by the executive branch.

item.title: The biggest surprises (and snubs) from the 2026 Golden Globe nominations
item.description: “One Battle After Another” dominated, as expected, while a surging “Sentimental Value” poured water all over “Wicked: For Good.”

item.title: Mom of White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt’s nephew is set free on bond as she fights potential deportation
item.description: The release of Bruna Ferreira, 33, who shares custody of an 11-year-old son with her former fiancé, Leavitt’s brother Michael, comes nearly a month after immigration officers detained her in Massachusetts while she was on her way to pick up their son from school and sent her to the South Louisiana ICE Processing Center.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Unemployment and health issues add up to ‘feeling inadequate’
item.description: Carolyn Hax: Unemployment and health issues add up to ‘feeling inadequate’

item.title: Trump to announce $12 billion tariff relief for farmers
item.description: Farmers, a key segment of President Donald Trump’s base, faced fallout from his tariff policies. The assistance package is expected to particularly help soybean farmers, who have seen a precipitous drop in sales this year.

item.title: I was a red state governor. What I saw at Harvard surprised me.
item.description: The spirit of association remains alive in unexpected places.

item.title: Paramount launches hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, challenging Netflix’s $83 billion deal
item.description: The David Ellison-run company is promising Warner Bros. Discovery shareholders a deal it says is more lucrative and easier for the Trump administration to approve.

item.title: Trump has pardoned or commuted nearly 100 people for drug crimes, despite his anti-drug rhetoric
item.description: A Chicago gang leader, a Baltimore kingpin and a former Honduran president accused of leading a vast “narco-state” are among those who have been granted clemency during the president’s two terms, a Post analysis found.

item.title: D.C. Police Chief Pamela Smith steps down, Bowser says
item.description: Mayor Muriel E. Bowser praised Smith for her service but did not offer a reason for her departure.

item.title: Immigration crackdown. Kennedy Center. Venezuela. Child deaths. Aging study. College football. Lanternfly honey. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Kennedy Center Honors get a shakeup from its host: Trump
item.description: The president curated, and then emceed, the arts center’s marquee event, which honored Michael Crawford, Gloria Gaynor, Kiss, Sylvester Stallone and George Strait.

item.title: Lanternfly honey has arrived. Just don’t ask how it’s made.
item.description: The impact of spotted lanternflies is showing up in a less obvious way: It’s changing honey. Exactly how that change happens may not be the best selling point.

item.title: Donald Trump’s Kennedy Center is showier, emptier and more political
item.description: The center is now guided by a board of Trump loyalists and a new staff, including its president, Richard Grenell. Nearly 10 months in, a picture of the transformed institution has come into view as its biggest night approaches: the Kennedy Center Honors.

item.title: The College Football Playoff bracket is set. See who made the 12-team field.
item.description: The field and bracket were released by the CFP selection committee Sunday afternoon. The event begins with four first-round games at campus sites Dec. 19 and 20, and it concludes with the national championship game Jan. 19 in Miami Gardens, Florida.

item.title: Still need to finish this weekend’s On the Record? We’ve got you.
item.description: Still need to finish this weekend’s On the Record? We’ve got you.

item.title: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now
item.description: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now

item.title: The mother of Karoline Leavitt’s nephew rejects the White House’s narrative of her ICE arrest
item.description: Bruna Ferreira, who chose the White House press secretary as her son’s godmother, said in an interview that it is insulting to sit in orange prison scrubs facing possible removal to Brazil while the Trump administration paints her as a criminal and an absentee mother.

item.title: A planned copper mine threatens a sacred Apache tradition
item.description: A girl's coming-of-age ceremony could be the last at Oak Flat before copper mining potentially transforms the site in Arizona.

item.title: For years, she was told it was stress. Then a brain scan revealed the real cause.
item.description: After years of misdiagnoses and unexplained symptoms, Annie Sedoric finally discovered the rare condition that was reshaping her body.

item.title: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.
item.description: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.

item.title: Rosie O’Donnell moved to Ireland to escape Trump. Did it work?
item.description: The American entertainer fled to the Emerald Isle when Donald Trump returned to the White House. Even with an ocean between them, their long feud boils on. But her new country has transformed her.

item.title: I suspected a hidden killer lurked inside my body. Here’s what I found.
item.description: Like many emerging technologies, Dana Milbank observes, this one can improve our lives, make us miserable or both. Nobody knows yet which it will be.

item.title: Frank Gehry dies at 96. The architect’s unearthly but brilliant designs became global landmarks.
item.description: Gehry was considered one of the most imaginative and expressive architects of his generation and ranked among the most important designers since Frank Lloyd Wright.

item.title: The World Cup group stage is set. The U.S. men’s national team will open against Paraguay.
item.description: As the opponents were drawn during Friday’s event at the Kennedy Center in Washington, the U.S. men’s national soccer team learned it will face Australia, Paraguay and a European playoff winner in Group D. Coach Mauricio Pochettino’s American squad will open play against Paraguay on June 12 at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.

item.title: Supreme Court will hear case on Trump’s ban on birthright citizenship
item.description: The announcement sets up a test of a controversial policy that could redefine who is considered an American.

item.title: Carolyn Hax chat: Mom’s over-the-top Christmas leaves no room for what I want
item.description: Carolyn Hax chat: Mom’s over-the-top Christmas leaves no room for what I want

item.title: FIFA’s stage is set, with Trump and soccer in the spotlight at the Kennedy Center. Follow our coverage.
item.description: Soccer teams will learn their group stage opponents at the draw for the 2026 World Cup, which will be held in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

item.title: CDC panel makes most sweeping revision to child vaccine schedule under RFK Jr.
item.description: The panel voted to eliminate a long-standing recommendation for every newborn to receive a hepatitis B shot, excluding those born to mothers testing negative.

item.title: 10 questions, and don't forget the bonus wager! Finish off your week with On the Record.
item.description: Think you’ve got what it takes to earn a perfect score? Take today’s longer news quiz and complete your point total for the week.

item.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in $83 billion cash-stock deal
item.description: The largest streaming network says it will purchase Warner Bros.’ studios and streaming assets after winning a bidding war with Comcast and Paramount.

item.title: Boat strike. Redistricting fight. Pipe bomb suspect. Trump’s ballroom. Pesticides. Social media ban. Black Death. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Video shows a second U.S. military strike on alleged drug smugglers hit before survivors could flip boat, lawmakers say
item.description: The footage was shown on Capitol Hill, where Adm. Frank M. Bradley faced a day of difficult questions about the deadly operation he oversaw.

item.title: Supreme Court hands Trump a victory in fight over Texas congressional map
item.description: The court has cleared the way for a voting map in Texas that could allow Republicans to win up to five additional seats in the House.

item.title: Grand jury refuses to reindict Letitia James in mortgage fraud case
item.description: The Trump administration had sought a new indictment in Virginia after a judge had dismissed a case against the New York attorney general last week.

item.title: Maryland House speaker steps down from role where she made history
item.description: Adrienne A. Jones was the first Black person and first woman to lead the Maryland House of Delegates. She said it was time for a new generation to lead.

item.title: ‘Signalgate’ report contradicts Hegseth’s claim of ‘total exoneration’
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s actions “created a risk to operational security,” according to an independent assessment publicly released Thursday by the Pentagon’s inspector general.
